answers.answer: i get that when my blood sugar gets screwed up...i have diabetes....otherwise dunno.
Thanks for the info.  I don't have diabetes but maybe my blood sugar level is still off a bit. I'll check it out.  thanks, Kelly

Hi,The following medical conditions are some of the possible causes of Gum numbness. There are likely to be other possible causes, so ask your doctor about your symptoms.* Diabetes* Infection* Peripheral neuropathy* Peripheral artery disease (see Artery symptoms)* Peripheral nerve trauma (see Nerve symptoms)* Peripheral nerve compression (see Nerve symptoms)* Cold* Compartment syndrome* Cerebrovascular accident* Gum injury* Mouth injuryYou would to see your doctor to find out the cause in your case.Let us know about how you are doing and if you have any other doubts.Regards.

question: About a month ago I developed numbness in my tongue now I have lost my sense of taste.  Just to throw it out there I have also been having horrible pain in both feet 24 hrs a day.  Doctors think it is torn ligaments so I don't think the two are related, just thought I would mention it.   Anyone ever had this problem?
title: numbness in tongue and upper lip no sense of taste.
